subject: Bicycles and Bicycling
Tour de France (Bicycle Race)
lead_paragraph: Cycling’s international governing body will not recognize this year’s Paris-Nice race in an escalating dispute with the group that also organizes the Tour de France. Pat McQuaid, chief of the International Cycling Union, sent a letter Monday to all professional teams asking that they not compete in the Paris-Nice race organized by the French group Amaury Sport Organization. The rift is also threatening the Tour, with the cycling federation threatening to withdraw antidoping regulators from the event if the A.S.O. and French cycling authorities do not hold their events under the federation’s jurisdiction.
